column1: Purpose: Defines what the male narrative expects or assumes in relational dynamics.

column4: “She’s content if she doesn’t critique”
“She’s close if she doesn’t need words”
“She’s aligned if she doesn’t resist”
“She trusts me if she doesn’t ask”
“She’s stable if she doesn’t react”
“We’re good if we laugh”
“She respects me if she lets me cool off”
“She wants me if she’s physical”
“She trusts me if she follows”
“She’s easy if she doesn’t cry”
“She’s reliable if she does it automatically”
“She’s mine if she stays quiet”
“We’re aligned if she agrees”
“She values me if she says it first”
“She’s mature if she lets me be”
“We’re okay if we’re still physical”
“She supports me if she doesn’t challenge me”
“She forgives me if she doesn’t dig”
“We’re close if we joke together”
“She’s mine if she doesn’t share with others”
